verb.description: Make a prominent exhibition of (something) in a place where it can be easily seen.
examples: the palace used to display a series of Flemish tapestries
a handwritten notice was displayed in the ticket office

noun.description: A performance, show, or event intended for public entertainment.
An electronic device for the visual presentation of data.

origin: Middle English (in the sense unfurl, unfold): from Old French despleier, from Latin displicare scatter, disperse (in medieval Latin unfold). Compare with deploy.
